title: Blended Mathematical Problem-Solving Education for Interprofessional Collaboration in Healthcare

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Statistics and Data Analysis Competency, Professional Field Experience
context.additional_context: A course for novice professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to enhance collaborative problem-solving skills using mathematical modeling in BYOD environments.

learning_goals: Learners can form teams with at least three experts from other disciplines to solve medical data-driven decision-making problems.
Learners can develop mathematical models to integrate and analyze qualitative and quantitative data according to mixed-methods research methodologies.
Learners can establish collaborative strategies considering role differences among professionals and reflect them in project deliverables.

resources: Online collaboration platforms (e.g., Notion, Google Workspace)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
